docs.title: SocialRadio
docs.text: Broadcast your playlist, mix, or set along with your voice, to the world. Tune in to other broadcasts and jump in the conversation with comments, or show your support with quick reactions. An interactive UI for AutomixIQ.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
SocialRadio is a framework that exposes an interactive UI to AutomixIQ as well as the capability to leverage Pacemaker Technology to start a broadcast with music from your catalog, your voice and other content, as well as joining available broadcasts, interact with other members of a community or the broacaster, and more.

This documentation provides a step-by-step guide on how to get started with using the SocialRadio in your application.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: You can find the documentation of available APIs here: SocialRadio API Reference

docs.title: AutomixIQ
docs.text:
SocialRadio works on top of AutomixIQ. If you want to use SocialRadio together with AutomixIQ you can. Please note that manipulating playback or queue with AutomixIQ when a user is creating or consuming a radio broadcast may impact the radio broadcast itself and is therefore discouraged.

The documentation for AutomixIQ can be found here: AutomixIQ Documentation

docs.title: Change Log
docs.text: This is a beta build - No change log available at the moment.

docs.title: Configure the SDK with Tuned Global backend
Overview
docs.text:
This document explains how to integrate AutomixIQ with your application if it is already using Tuned Global’s backend to access tracks and metadata.

To initialise SocialRadio with Tuned Global's API and services, you need

  • A store ID and an application ID provided by the Tuned Global team
  • An implementation of the SocialRadioTunedRestHook interface

docs.title: Implement your SocialRadioTunedRestHook
docs.text:
SocialRadioTunedRestHook is an interface that facilitates communication between the Tuned Global Backend and the SocialRadio SDK regarding the user's access token and device information. Extend the SocialRadioTunedRestHook class and implement the required functions as shown below:

  • getAuthenticatedDevice
  • getUniqueDeviceIdentifier
  • onTunedRestTokenExpired

You can find a detailed explanation in API Reference

class MyTunedRestHook: SocialRadioTunedRestHook {

    // Return the Tuned API device ID integer
    override suspend fun getAuthenticatedDevice(uniqueDeviceIdentifier: String): String? {
        val myTunedDeviceId: String = tunedDeviceId
        return myTunedDeviceId
    }

    // Return an ID that can be used to identify a device.
    // This is typically a randomly generated UUID that persists through app restarts.
    override fun getUniqueDeviceIdentifier(): String {
        val uuid: String = myUniqueDeviceIdentifier
        return uuid
    }

    // Use the info provided from the parameters to refresh the Tuned user token
    override suspend fun onTunedRestTokenExpired(uniqueDeviceIdentifier: String,
                                                 countryCode: String,
                                                 tunedUserId: String?,
                                                 oldAccessToken: String?,
                                                 refreshToken: String?,
                                                 tokenType: String?): TunedAuthenticationResponse? {
        // your implementation of refreshing Tuned user token
        val tunedAuthenticationResponse: TunedAuthenticationResponse? = null
        withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
            suspendCancellableCoroutine { continuation ->
                refreshToken(refreshToken, tokenType, uniqueDeviceIdentifier) { authToken, tokenType, tokenExpiration, refreshToken ->
                    val userId = tunedUserId
                    tunedAuthenticationResponse = TunedAuthenticationResponse(authToken,
                                                                              tokenType,
                                                                              tokenExpiration,
                                                                              refreshToken,
                                                                              tunedUserId)
                    continuation.resume(Unit)
                }
            }
        }
        return tunedAuthenticationResponse
    }
}

docs.title: Implement your SocialRadioRadioUIListener
docs.text:
SocialRadioRadioUIListener is an interface that provides data required for the Radio UI to function, as well as being responsible for presenting UI SocialRadio is not able to do on its own. Extend the SocialRadioRadioUIListener class and implement the required (an optionally, those marked as optinal) methods as shown below:

  • presentTracklist
  • presentAuthentication
  • presentProfile
  • isTrackLiked
  • setTrackLiked

and optionally,

  • onDismiss
  • onDestroy
class MyRadioUIListener: SocialRadioRadioUIListener {

    override fun presentTracklist(context: Context, completion: (tracks: List<AutomixSDKTrackModel>?, playlistName: String?) -> Unit) {
        // Your implementation for presenting UI that allows to select one or more tracks:
        // - Feed the track/tracks selected as the second paramenter of the completion block,
        // - If the tracks selected are part of a playlist, feed the name opf that playlist as the thirsd parameter of the completion block.
        val context = myActivityContext
        val myTracklist = MyTracklist(context = myActivityContext, selectedTracksBloc = { tracks, playlistName ->
            completion(track, playlist, playlistName)
        })
        myTracklist.show()
    }

    override fun presentAuthentication(context: Context, completion: (success: Boolean) -> Unit) {
        // At a time where SocialRadio requires a Tuned User Id, if it does not have one it will require the user to authenticate by calling this function.
        // Present your login block here
        val context = myActivityContext
        val myLoginDialog = MyLoginDialog(context = myActivityContext, onLogin = { success -> 
            completion(success)
        })
        myLoginDialog.show()
    }

    override fun presentProfile(context: Context, identifier: String?, completion: () -> Unit) {
        // At times, SocialRadio will need to present a users' profile. It will do so by calling this function.
        val context = myActivityContext
        val myProfileDialog = MyProfileDialog(context = myActivityContext)
        myProfileDialog.show()
    }

    override fun isTrackLiked(identifier: String, completion: (isLiked: Boolean) -> Unit) {
        // At times, SocialRadio will need to know if a track is part of the user's "Liked" playlist.
        // It will ask the client application to do so by calling this method.
        // You can take your time to load the liked playlist if you do not have it around in order to respond.
        // You can respond synchronously if you do know
        val likedPlaylist = myLikedPlaylist
        completion(myLikedPlaylist.contains(identifier))
    }

    override fun setTrackLiked(
            identifier: String,
            liked: Boolean,
            completion: (error: RadioSDKError?, success: Boolean) -> Unit) {
        // SocialRadio allows for a user to flag/unflag a track as Liked. When that happens, it will call this method.
        val likedPlaylist = myLikedPlaylist
        if(liked) {
            likedPlaylist.add(identifier)
        } else {
            likedPlaylist.remove(identifier)
        }
    }

docs.title: Initialise SocialRadio instance
docs.text:
Create an SocialRadioRadioSDKConfig first. The store and application ID will be provided by the Tuned Global team. You can tweak the SocialRadio UI and available feature set by changing flags on the cofing object.

val radioConfig =
    SocialRadioRadioSDKConfig.Builder()
        .apiKey(myAPIKey)
        .country(myCountryISO2Code) // Device country code e.g. "US", "AU"
        .storeId(myTunedStoreId )
        .applicationId(myTunedApplicationId)
        .build()

Initialise the RadioSDK instance with the SocialRadioTunedRestHook, SocialRadioRadioUIListener and SocialRadioConfig created in previous steps. We recommend initialising the SDK once your music background service is up and running.

Note

SocialRadio requires an active internet connection for its initial verification. After this initial setup, it can be initialised offline. However, note that there is a grace period of 7 days, after which an internet connection will be required again for re-verification.

    SocialRadio.initialise(applicationContext = applicationContext,
                           streamingListener = myTunedRestHook,
                           config = radioConfig,
                           radioUIListener = radioUIListener,
                           onComplete = { automixStatus ->

        // The SocialRadio public functions can be used from this point onwards :)

        // We can add a status listener to get UI updates and play events, you can add as many AutomixSDKStatusListener as you like
        val socialRadioStatusListener: SocialRadioStatusListener = mySocialRadioStatusListener
        SocialRadio.getInstance()?.addStatusListener(socialRadioStatusListener)

        // ...
    }, onError = { socialRadioError, socialRadioStatus -> 
        // This means you do not have permission to use SocialRadio or there is no internet connection when required.
        return
    })

docs.title: Implement SocialRadioStatusListener (Optional)
docs.text: The SocialRadioStatusListener is responsible for updating your player’s UI, please refer to Update UI

docs.title: Check initialised state
docs.text:
To check whether SocialRadio is initialised 

SocialRadio.getInstance()?.initialised()

docs.title: Shut down
docs.text:
To shut down SocialRadio

SocialRadio.terminate()

After you have terminated the SDK, you will need to reinitialise if you want to use SocialRadio again.

docs.title: Data model
docs.text: List of enums and data models used by SocialRadio to communicate with the client app.

docs.title: Enums
docs.text: • RadioSDKError

docs.text:
• SocialRadioList
  • SocialRadioListItem
  • SocialRadioUser
  • SocialRadioMixtape
  • SocialRadioMixtapeCounters
  • SocialRadioMixtapeLite
  • SocialRadioMixtapeTrack
  • SocialRadioMixtapeTrackImage

docs.title: Get available broadcasts
docs.text:
When you want to fetch a list of currently available live broadcasts as paged request, you use this function as shown below:

  • getLiveShows
Get available broadcasts
class MyApplicationActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

    ...
    fun getShows() {
        val limit: Int = 10             // Get a total of 10 shows
        val start: Int = 0              // Get the first shows
        SocialRadio.getInstance())?.getLiveBroadcasts(limit = limit, start = start,
                                                      onComplete = { liveBroadcasts ->
            // Present the broadcasts on your UI
            val myLiveBroadcasts = myLiveBroadcast
            myLiveBroadcast.add(liveBroadcasts)
            if(liveBroadcasts.size < limit) {
                // There are more shows available!
                getNextLiveBroadcastsPage()
            }
        },
        onError = { error ->
            Log.i("MyLog", "Failed to get live broadcasts")
        })
    }
    ...
}

docs.title: Handle error
docs.text:
Most of the public APIs of SocialRadio will return a SocialRadioError object through the onError method if any error is encountered.

You can find a detailed list of errors here: SocialRadioError Reference.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: This SDK requires a minimum of Android API Level 21.

docs.title: Importing artifacts
docs.text:
SocialRadio can be brought into your project via our private maven repository.

Step 1: Include Tuned Global's maven repository

settings.gradle.kts
dependencyResolutionManagement {
     repositoriesMode.set(RepositoriesMode.FAIL_ON_PROJECT_REPOS)
     repositories {
         // ...
         maven(url = "https://tunedglobal.pkgs.visualstudio.com/TunedGlobalPublic/_packaging/builds/maven/v1")
         // ...
     }
}

Step 2: Add the dependency to your target

build.gradle.kts
val socialRadioVersion = project.findProperty("com.tunedglobal.socialradio.version")

dependencies {
    // ...
    implementation("org.greenrobot:eventbus:3.3.1")
    implementation("com.tunedglobal:radiosdk:$socialRadioVersion")
    // ...
}

Step 3: You should now be able to use SocialRadio

import com.tunedglobal.radio.*

docs.title: Configure Proguard (Optional)
docs.text:
If you have any issues finding classes in the SDK, try adding the following to your Proguard configuration.

# Automix SDK
-keep class com.tunedglobal.automix.logic.cpp.AMJNILib  {
    public static *;
    public *;
}
-keep class com.tunedglobal.radio.logic.cpp.nativewidgets.NativeWidgetsHelper {
    public static *;
    public *;
}
-keep class com.tunedglobal.radio.logic.cpp.notifications.NotificationsHelper {
    public static *;
    public *;
}
-keep class com.tunedglobal.radio.logic.cpp.DialogsHelper  {
    public static *;
    public *;
}
-keep class com.tunedglobal.radio.logic.cpp.ImageHelper  {
    public static *;
    public *;
}
-keep class com.tunedglobal.radio.logic.cpp.LocalisationHelper {
    public static *;
    public *;
}
-keep class com.tunedglobal.radio.logic.cpp.RadioUI {
    public static *;
    public *;
}
-keep class com.tunedglobal.radio.logic.cpp.SamplePlayerHelper {
    public static *;
    public *;
}
-keep class com.tunedglobal.radio.logic.cpp.SocialLayerHelper {
    public static *;
    public *;
}
-keep class com.tunedglobal.radio.logic.cpp.TextRenderHelper {
    public static *;
    public *;
}

docs.title: Join a broadcast
docs.text:
When you want to join an existing radio broadcast to listen to and interact with it, you use this function as shown below:

  • joinLiveMixtape

This interface will present the live broadcast and play it, and also provides UI elements to minimise or exit the live session.

Join a broadcast
class MyApplicationActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

    ...
    fun onJoinLiveBroadcastButtonPressed(indentifier: String) {
        val context = this
        SocialRadio.getInstance()?.joinLiveBroadcast(context = context,
                                                     identifier = identifier,
                                                     onComplete = { intent -> 
            startActivity(intent)
        }, onError = { error -> 
            Log.i("MyLog", "RadioSession failed to join")
        })
    }
    ...
}

When you want to programatically force-end a radio session the user is listening to, use this function as shown below:

  • endRadioSession
End a broadcast
class MyApplicationActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

    ...
    fun onEndRadioSessionButtonPressed() {
        SocialRadio.getInstance().endRadioSession()
    }
    ...

}

docs.title: Moderation
docs.text:
SocialRadio offers moderation of content by allowing the user to report inapropriate mixtapes or users. To do so, you use

  • reportUser
  • reportMixtape
Reporting inapropriate content
class MyApplicationActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

    ...
    fun onReportUserButtonPressed(identifier: String) {
        RadioSDK.getInstance()?.reportUser(identifier, onComplete = {
        },
        onError = { error, status -> 
            Log.i("MyLog", "RadioSession failed to report a user")
        })
    }

    fun onReportMixtapeButtonPressed(identifier: String) {
        SocialRadio.getInstance()?.reportMixtape(identifier, onComplete = {
        },
        onError = { error, status -> 
            Log.i("MyLog", "RadioSession failed to report a user")
        })
    }
    ...

}

SocialRadio also offers the possibility of sending users a notification. To do so, you use

  • notifyFollowers
Notifying users
class MyApplicationActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

    ...
    fun notifyFollowers(identifier: String, title: String, body: String, objectType: String?, objectId: String?) {
        SocialRadio.getInstance()?.notifyFollowers(userIdentifier = identifier, title, body, objectType, objectId, onComplete = {
        },
        onError = { error -> 
            Log.i("MyLog", "RadioSession failed to notify users")
        })
    }
    ...

}

docs.title: Start a broadcast
docs.text:
When you want to start a radio broadcast, you use this function as shown below:

  • startRadioSession

You can either start a radio session with a bunch of identifiers, or an empty one. This function will not make the user go live with his or her session inmediately, instead it will create a draft he or she can edit or curate first.

This function provides an Activity with the SocialRadio UI. Starting that activity will allow the user to curate that playlist, and when ready, go "Live" with it.

Start a broadcast
class MyApplicationActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

    ...
    fun onStartRadioSessionButtonPressed() {
        val context = this
        val identifiers: List<String>? = myIdentifiers                   // Can be null
        val metadata: List<AutomixSDKTrackModel>? = null                 // Populate if available
        SocialRadio.getInstance()?.startRadioSession(context = context,
                                                     identifiers = identifiers,
                                                     metadata = metadata,
                                                     playTrackIndex = 0, seconds = 0F, autoplay = true,
                                                     contextType = null,
                                                     contextId = null,
                                                     onComplete = { intent, status -> 
            startActivity(intent)
        },
        onError = { error, status -> 
            Log.i("MyLog", "RadioSession failed to create")
        })
    }
    ...

}

When you want to programatically force-end a radio session the user has created, use this function as shown below:

  • endRadioSession
End a broadcast
class MyApplicationActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

    ...
    fun onEndRadioSessionButtonPressed() {
        SocialRadio.getInstance().endRadioSession()
    }
    ...

}

docs.title: Update UI
docs.text: SocialRadio provides realtime status update and playback events after the player starts playing. You can register multiple listeners to monitor the status of the player and update your UI accordingly.

docs.title: Register status listener
docs.text:
You can register a status listener any time after the SDK is initialised.

SocialRadio.getInstance()?.addStatusListener(myStatusListener)

docs.title: Unregister status listener
docs.text:
You can unregister the listener and stop receiving status updates and events when you do not need it any more.

SocialRadio.getInstance()?.removeStatusListener(myStatusListener)

docs.title: Implement status listener
docs.text:
Extend the SocialRadioStatusListener class and implement the required functions as shown below:

  • onStatusChanged
class MyStatusListener: SocialRadioStatusListener {

    override fun onStatusChanged(variables: List<AutomixIQStatusVariable>, status: AutomixIQStatus) {
        // Monitor status update
    }
}

docs.title: Monitor status update
docs.text:
SocialRadio reports the player status every time it is updated. You can get the current player status from the SocialRadioStatus object and the list of SocialRadioStatusVariable that gets updated since the last time a onStatusChanged is invoked. Use the value of each AutomixIQStatusVariable to update your player UI.

For details of each status field, see SocialRadioStatus and SocialRadioStatusVariable

var latestStatus: SocialRadioStatus? = null

override fun onStatusChanged(variables: List<SocialRadioStatusVariable>, status: SocialRadioStatus) {
    // Monitor status update

    this.latestStatus = status

    for (property in variables) {    
        when (property) {
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.PLAYING -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.MIXING -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.PLAYING_TRACK_IDENTIFIER -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.PLAYING_TRACK_INDEX -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.PLAYING_TRACK_CURRENT_TIME -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.PLAYING_TRACK_TOTAL_TIME -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.PLAYLIST -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.FAILED_TRACK_LOAD_IDENTIFIERS -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.EXPLICIT_LYRICS_FILTERING -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.MIX_ID -> {}
            SocialRadioStatusVariable.PLAYBACK_MODE -> {}
        }
    }
}

A helper function have been created to help you easily get the value of specific SocialRadioStatusVariable from SocialRadioStatus

Get value for AutomixIQStatusVariable
SocialRadioStatus.getValue<T>(AutomixIQStatusVariable)
